gurmukhi: piq BeIXn ky bDby kI biRQw ju huqI mn mY soeI BwK deI ]suin kY muK qy iqh isMD jrw Aiq kop kY AwNK sroj qeI ]1029]
transliteration: Pat(i) Bhaeeyan Ke Badhhe Kibrithaa Ju Houtiman Mai Soibhaakh Daee|| Soun(i) Kai Moukh Te Tih Sindh Jaraa At(i) Kop Kai Aankh Daroj Taee||1029||
translation: They told the story of the killing of their husband and their brother, hearing which the eyes of Jarasandh reddened with rage.1029.

gurmukhi: hir hlDrih sMGwirhoN duihqw pRiq kih bYn ]rjDwnI qy insirXo mMqR bulwey sYn ]1030]
transliteration: Har(i) Haldharah(i) Sanhaarihon Duhitaa Prati Kah(i) Bain|| Rajdhaanite Nidariyo Mantra Bulaae Sain||1030||
translation: Jarasandh said to his daughter, “I shall kill Krishna and Balram,” and saying this he gathered together his ministers and armies and left his capital.1030.

gurmukhi: dys dys prDwn pTwey ]nrpiq sB dysn qy lXwey ]Awie niRpq ko kIn juhwrU ]dXo bhuq Dn iqn auphwrU ]1031]
transliteration: Des Des Pardhaan Pathaae|| Narpat(i) Sabh Desan Te Lyaae|| Ooe Nripat Ko Keen Juhdaroo|| Dayo Bahout Dhan Tin Oup-hdaroo||1031||
translation: He sent his envoys to various countries, who brought the kings of all those countries; they reverently; bowed before the king and gave great amount of money as present.1031.

gurmukhi: jrw isMD bhu suBt bulwey ]BwNiq BwNiq ky SsqR bMDwey ]gj bwjn pr pwKn fwrI ]isr pr kMcn isrI svwrI ]1032]
transliteration: Jaraa Sindh Hahu Soubhat Bulaae|| Bhaant(i) Bhaant(i) Ke Shastra Bandhaae|| Gad Baajan Par Paakhanndddaree|| Sir Par Kanchanndsirisavdaree||1032||
translation: Jarasandh called many warriors and equipped them with various kinds of weapons; the saddles were tightened on the backs of the elephants and horses and the crowns of gold were worn on the heads.1032.

gurmukhi: pwiek rQ bhuqy juir Awey ]BUpiq Awgy sIs invwey ]ApnI ApnI imsl sB gey ]pwNiq jor kir TFy Bey ]1033]
transliteration: Paaik Rath Bahoute Jur(i) Aae|| Bhoopat(i) Aage Sees Nivaae|| Apniapanimisal Sabh Gad|| Paant(i) Jor Kar(i) Thadhe Bhae||1033||
translation: Many warriors gathered there both on foot and on chariots and they all bowed their heads before the king. They joined their own divisions and stood in ranks.1033.

gurmukhi: Xih sYnw cqurMg jrwisMD niRp kI bnI ]sjXo kvc inKMg DnuK bwn lY rQ cVXo ]1034]
transliteration: Yah(i) Sainaa Chaturan Jaraasindh Nrip Kibanee|| Sajyo Kavach Nikhannddhanoukh Baan Lai Rath Chadyo||1034||
translation: All the four divisions of the army of Jarasandh were ready and the king himself mounted on the chariot taking his armour, quiver, bow and arrows etc.1034.

gurmukhi: jor cmUM sB mMqRIAn lY qb XoN rn swj smwj bnwXo ]qyeIs CUhnI lY dl sMg bjwie kY bMb qhw khN DwXo ]
transliteration: Jor Chamoond Sabh Mantreean Lai Tab Yon Ran Saaj Samaaj Banaayo|| Teees Chhodhhanilai Dal San Bajaae Kai Banb Tahaa Kahan Dhaayo||
translation: Taking alongwith him all the four divisions of his army and his ministers, the king launched the vicious war; he moved with dreadful tundering alongwith his twenty-three units of huge armies;

gurmukhi: bIr bfy sm rwvn ky iqn kau sMg lY mirby khu AwXo ]mwnhu kwl pRlY idn bwrD PYl prXo jl XoN dlu CwXo ]1035]
transliteration: Beer Bade Sam Raavan Ke Tin Kau San Lai Mar(i)hai Kauh Aayo|| Maanoh Kaal Pralai Din Baaradh Phail Jal Yon Dal(u) Chhaado||1035||
translation: He reached alongwith powerful Ravana like heroes; his forces were spread like the sea at the time of dissolution.1035.
